questiontext.text:
Exercise

Which of the following differential equations is satisfied by \(y=A\cosh 2x+B\sinh 2x\) where \(A\) and \(B\) are arbitrary constants.

generalfeedback.text:
We are given\(y=A\cosh 2x+B\sinh 2x\) where \(A\) and \(B\) are arbitrary constants.

Differentiating once we obtain \[{dy\over dx}=2A\sinh 2x +2B\cosh 2x.\]Differentiating a second time we obtain \[{d^2y\over {dx^2}}=4A\cosh 2x +4B\sinh 2x.\] Hence \[ {d^2y\over {dx^2}}=4y\]
